title: First look inside super-sleek SpaceX capsule that will take paying customers into orbit - in style
text:
If you're going to travel into space , you might as well do it in style.
And if this latest video from SpaceX is anything to go by, strapping in to go to the stars could be as comfy as taking a ride in a luxury sports car.
The company has revealed the first look at the inside of the Dragon capsule, which will take astronauts up to the International Space Station (ISS).
There are seven seats (made from carbon fibre and Alcantara cloth) on board each capsule.
Astronauts also get a light-up control panel and the ability to adjust the temperature.
The astronauts' control panel on board the SpaceX Dragon
It's fitted with windows, so the astronauts can get a full few of the Earth as they leave it.
"Dragon made history in 2012 when it became the first commercial spacecraft to deliver cargo to the space station, a feat previously achieved only by governments," SpaceX said.
"But Dragon was also designed from the beginning to carry people, and today SpaceX is finalizing the necessary refinements to make that a reality."
